Class TerminalScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • mh.TerminalScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class TerminalScreen
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener
    A terminal screen panel.
    Author:
    Martin Hepperle, July 2019
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

                       int size)
        Load a TrueType font and return a scaled instance.
        Parameters:
        fontFileName - The name of the font file.
        size - The desired size of the font.
        Returns:
        An instance of the font or a PLAIN, MONOSPACED font if the TrueType font file cannot be found.

      • clearAllTabs

        public void clearAllTabs()

      • setDefaultTabs

        public void setDefaultTabs(int step)
        Distribute TAB stops in regular intervals.
        Parameters:
        step - The horizontal position increment from TAB to TAB.
        Example: TAB step = 5 - a TAB in in every 5th column. 
                    1   5   9   13  17  21   screen coordinates
            |   |   |   |   |   | 
            123456789012345678901234567890
            |   |   |   |   |   |  
            0   4   8   12  16  20   array index

      • setTab

        public void setTab()
        Set a TAB stop at the current cursor position.

      • clearTab

        public void clearTab()
        Clear any TAB stop at the current cursor position.

      • setTab

        public void setTab(int x)
        Set a TAB stop at the given cursor position.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal position where a TAB stop is set [1...WIDTH].

      • clearTab

        public void clearTab(int x)
        Clear any TAB stop at the given cursor position.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal position where a TAB stop is removed [1...WIDTH].

      • nextTab

        public int nextTab()
        Returns:
        The next TAB position in [1...WIDTH].
        If there is no following TAB stop the current position is returned,

      • prevTab

        public int prevTab()
        Returns:
        The previous TAB position in [1...WIDTH].
        If there is no preceding TAB stop the current position is returned,

      • saveCursor

        public void saveCursor()

      • restoreCursor

        public void restoreCursor()

      • setLineWrap

        public void setLineWrap(boolean enable)
        Define the behavior of the cursor at the end of a line.
        Parameters:
        enable - if true, the cursor wraps to the next line. The screen scrolls up if the end of the view is reached and the cursor is not yet at the end of the screen memory.

      • clearScreen

        public void clearScreen()
        Clear the visible screen. The view is filled with blank characters.

      • clearMemory

        public void clearMemory()
        Clear the complete screen memory. The page memory is filled with blank characters.

      • clear

        public void clear(int idxFirst,
                  int idxLast)
        Fill a region of memory by filling with Space characters. Also resets the attribute byte for each cell.
        Parameters:
        idxFirst - index of first character to clear.
        idxLast - index of last character to clear.

      • setInsertMode

        public void setInsertMode(boolean onoff)
        Set the character insert mode. If true, subsequent characters are inserted, otherwise they overwrite.
        Parameters:
        onoff - True if the insert mode shall be activated, otherwise False.

      • toggleInsertMode

        public void toggleInsertMode()
        Toggle the character insert mode flag.

      • lockKeyboard

        Set the keyboard locked flag.
        Parameters:
        yesno - True if the keyboard shall be locked, False otherwise..

      • isKeyboardLocked

        boolean isKeyboardLocked()
        Returns:
        True if the keyboard is currently locked, False if not.

      • setcursorVisible

        void setcursorVisible(boolean yesno)
        Set the cursor visibility flag.
        Parameters:
        yesno - True if the cursor shall be shown, False otherwise..

      • insertCharsInLine

        public void insertCharsInLine(int count)
        Insert one or more blank characters at the current position. All following characters up to the end of the line are shifted right by one. The last characters at the end of the line are lost. The cursor position is not updated
        Parameters:
        count - The number of blanks to insert.

      • deleteCharsInLine

        public void deleteCharsInLine(int count)
        Delete one or more characters at the current position and shift the rest of the line to the left. Blank character(s) are inserted at the end of the line.
        Parameters:
        count - The number of characters to delete.

      • idxBOS

        private int idxBOS()
        Returns:
        The index of the first character in the current view.

      • idxBOM

        private int idxBOM()
        Returns:
        The index of the first character in memory.

      • idxEOS

        private int idxEOS()
        Returns:
        The index of the last character at end of current view.

      • idxEOM

        private int idxEOM()
        Returns:
        The index of the last character at end of memory.

        private int idxCursor()
        Returns:
        The index of the current cursor position.

        private int idxBOL()
        Returns:
        The index of the first character on current line.

      • idxEOL

        private int idxEOL()
        Returns:
        The index of the last character on current line.

      • getStartRow

        public int getStartRow()
        Returns:
        - the starting row of the screen relative to memory.

      • getScreenLine

        java.lang.String getScreenLine(int row,
                               int offset,
                               int count)
        Return the text contained in a line of the current screen view.
        Parameters:
        row - the screen row [0...HEIGHT-1]
        offset - the starting column [0...WIDTH-1]
        count - the number of characters to copy [1...WIDTH-offset]
        Returns:
        The text contained in the given part of the line. If the number of defined characters in the line is shorter than offset+count only the defined length is returned.

      • getMemoryLine

        java.lang.String getMemoryLine(int row,
                               int offset,
                               int count)
        Return a line from global screen memory.
        Parameters:
        row - the memory row [0...HEIGHT*PAGES-1]
        offset - the starting column [0...WIDTH-1]
        count - the number of columns to copy [1...WIDTH-offset]
        Returns:
        a string with the characters starting at offset to the end of the line. If the number of defined characters in the line is shorter than offset+count only the defined length is returned.

      • clearToBOS

        public void clearToBOS()
        Erase from the cursor to the start of the current screen.

      • clearToEOM

        public void clearToEOM()
        Erase from the cursor to the end of the memory.

      • clearToEOS

        public void clearToEOS()
        Erase from the cursor to the end of the current screen.

      • clearToEOL

        public void clearToEOL()
        Erase from the cursor position (inclusive) to the end of line.

      • clearToBOL

        public void clearToBOL()
        Erase from the cursor position (inclusive) to the start of line.

      • clearChars

        public void clearChars(int count)
        Erase one or more characters starting at the cursor position. Does not erase beyond the end of the line.
        Parameters:
        count - The number of characters to erase.

      • clearLine

        public void clearLine()
        Erase the entire line

      • insertLine

        public void insertLine()
        Insert a new blank line at the current cursor row position and scroll the current and all following lines down. The last line at the end of memory is lost.

      • deleteCurrentLine

        public void deleteCurrentLine()
        Delete the current line and scroll the following lines up. A new empty line will appended to the bottom of the memory buffer.

      • homeScreenUp

        public void homeScreenUp()
        Move the cursor to the upper left of the screen .

      • homeScreenDown

        public void homeScreenDown()
        Move the cursor to the lower left of the screen .

      • scrollScreenUp

        public void scrollScreenUp(int rows)
        Shift the viewport up by one line so that the paper moves one line down.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows to scroll up.

      • scrollScreenDown

        public void scrollScreenDown(int rows)
        Shift the viewport down by one line so that the paper moves one line up.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows to scroll down.

      • pageScreenUp

        public void pageScreenUp()
        Shift the viewport up by one page so that the paper moves down. There is an overlap of of one line (the top line becomes the new bottom line).

      • pageScreenDown

        public void pageScreenDown()
        Shift the viewport down by one page so that the paper moves up. There is an overlap of of one line (the bottom line becomes the new top line).

      • scrollMemoryDown

        public void scrollMemoryDown()
        Shift the viewport down by one line by shifting the memory up. Delete the first line in memory and move the following lines up. Clear the new last line.

      • setCursorRelScreen

        public void setCursorRelScreen(int row,
                               int col)
        Set the cursor position relative to the current view.
        Parameters:
        row - row of cursor cell [0...HEIGHT-1]
        col - column of cursor cell [0...WIDTH-1]

      • setCursorRelMemory

                               int col)
        Set the cursor position relative to memory.
        Parameters:
        row - row of cursor cell [0...MEMORY_ROWS-1]
        col - column of cursor cell [0...WIDTH-1]

      • moveCursor

        public void moveCursor(int deltaRow,
                       int deltaCol)
        Move the cursor position by increment.
        Parameters:
        deltaRow - row movement +=down, -=up
        deltaCol - column movement, +=right, -=left

      • clipCursorToScreen

        private void clipCursorToScreen()
        Make sure that the cursor is inside screen bounds.

        x must be within [1...WIDTH].
        y must be within [1...HEIGHT].

      • clipViewToMemory

        private void clipViewToMemory()
        Make sure that the current viewport is completely inside the memory bounds.

        idxStart must be [0...(PAGES-1)*WIDTH*HEIGHT].

      • setAttribute

        public void setAttribute(byte a)
        Set the attribute byte for the following characters. This attribute will be used in all subsequent calls to putChar().
        Parameters:
        a - 0 == normal
        1 == highlight
        7 == inverse
        30...37 == foreground color
        40...47 == background color

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Neglects attributes.
        Returns:
        the text content of the terminal memory buffer. In Wndows each line is terminated by a '\n', in all other operating systems the sequence '\n\r' is used.
